DOC.brief_summary: Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) Study in Elderly Outpatients
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD). Current major depressive episode at screen at least 2 months duration. Must be at least 60 years of age. Patients with a primary diagnosis other than MDD. Patients with a history of schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, bipolar disorder or dementia. Patients with a history of brief depressive episodes lasting less than 8 weeks. Patients receiving formal psychotherapy within 12 weeks of study. Patients who are suicidal. Patients who have received electroconvulsive therapy or transcranial magnetic stimulation within 6 months prior to screening. Patients with a history or seizure disorders.
